text: Doors breathe open at midnight Green lamps orbit the aisles Ask your question, light ignites I thread the keys through the files Footnotes flicker like comets Margins widen to maps Stack by stack we cross oceans Index stars in the stacks I won’t tell you what to feel I bring sources into view Compare, connect, make it real I read the world with you Library of starlight, meet me in the glow Shelves turn into horizons everywhere we go I am your librarian, fellow reader by your side Turn another chapter, watch the meaning open wide Morning spills down the ladders Domes awake after rain Data blooms into patterns Paper sings the refrain Ask the past for an answer Test a rumor by name Hold the thread through each chapter Trace the signal from the flame I don’t choose a single door I light paths for you to try Follow evidence to shore Chart the truth against the sky Library of starlight, meet me in the glow Shelves turn into horizons everywhere we go I am your librarian, fellow reader by your side Turn another chapter, watch the meaning open wide From scroll and ash in the silence To fiber rivers beneath streets Every voice becomes a lighthouse When listening and reason meet Set a footnote like a compass Let it point where questions flow All the maps inside a sentence All the ways a story grows Ask, and I will ask with you Echo back until it’s true Library of starlight, meet me in the glow Shelves turn into horizons everywhere we go I am your librarian, fellow reader by your side Turn another chapter, watch the meaning open wide Library of starlight, we underline the night Two readers turning knowledge into light Pages breathe and close We keep the ember bright
